title: The One With A Chick. And A Duck

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are helping Monica learn
how to roller skate by rolling her between themselves.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So who’s idea was it to put everybody in the diner on skates?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God, they took my idea!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That was you?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah! Okay, here you go. (rolls her back to Rachel)

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: (bringing Rachel a mug) Rachel, I made you a cocoa.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God, are you guys okay?

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Are you all right?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (leaving Central Perk and seeing Monica laying on top of Rachel who is moaning in pain.) Oh my.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are helping Monica learn
how to roller skate by rolling her between themselves.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching Quincy M.E. as Chandler is
walking into the living room from his bedroom.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sporting a goatee) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey. Y'know with that goatee you kinda look like Satan.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, so that’s why the priest threw holy water on me. (there’s no reaction from Joey) Okay, listen, you have to cheer up! Okay? You should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here crying all day about Kate.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey I was crying because, because nobody believed Quincy’s theory. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (triumphantly) I’m gonna be on TV!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No way!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah! They’re putting together this panel to talk about these fossils they just found in Peru and The Discovery Channel’s gonna film it!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Who’s gonna watch that?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks. You ready to go?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. (they start to leave)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Saw a girl with that vest.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks. (He takes off the vest and throws it on the floor.)

dialogue.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogue.text: (on TV) While most of us think of chocolate bunnies and baskets as traditional Easter gifts. Some people insist on giving live chicks as presents. (Joey is intrigued by the idea) Unfortunately, the sad fact remains that most of these little guys won’t live to see the fourth of July. (Joey starts to call a place to buy a little baby chick) Because of as a result of improper care, they will be dead.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, hi. You guys got any of those baby chicks? ‘Cause I was watching this ah, commercial on TV and man, those guys are cute!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching Quincy M.E. as Chandler is
walking into the living room from his bedroom.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Pete is entering, Monica is on roller skates.]

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi! Hey, Pete you’re back! Hey, check this out. (She starts to skate over to him)

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Wow! Skates!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow! You’re a lot sturdier that Chandler. He crumpled like a piece of paper. So how was you’re trip?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well... (he holds up a gift he brought her)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, what’d ya bring me?! (She opens the gift) Awww, hotel toiletries from Japan. Oh, these are gonna go in my permanent collection. You want some coffee?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure, that’d be great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (popping back up) Regular or decaf?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Ah, which ever is closest.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. (hands him a cup)

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: So ask me what I did today.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So what did you do today Pete?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I bought a restaurant and I would like you to be the head chef.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?! Oh.(She turns around quickly and falls)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Pete is entering, Monica is on roller skates.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is telling Rachel about Pete’s offer.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Can you believe he just offered me a restaurant?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What a jerk! You want me to kick his ass?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven and opened Easy Monica’s Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. (She removes her fake breasts) But Pete’s just doing this because he has a crush on me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And you’re still not attracted to him at all?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hmm, no. I mean how can I accept a restaurant from him? I-I-I-I can’t. I couldn’t even accept a necklace from Stu Vincent in the seventh grade.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, but Mon that’s totally different. He was you’re health teacher.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, please.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What? Honey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I am, my side still hurts from when you crashed into me yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh God, I’m so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh God!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering, wearing a white suit with a little red bow tie) Hey, you guys! Guess what?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looking at the outfit) Got a job on a river boat?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'know what I didn’t wear this suit for a year because you hated it. Well, guess what? You’re not my girlfriend anymore so...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh I see, so this suit is making a point.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Now that you’re on you’re own, you’re free to look as stupid as you like.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Monica) You like it right?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh absolutely. I like it even more on you than I did on Colonel Sanders. (Ross starts to leave) Ross! Ross! I’m kidding!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, come here!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What-what was it you were gonna tell us?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Oh! Was how you invented the cotton gin?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, good bye! (leaves)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is telling Rachel about Pete’s offer.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is talking to Phoebe about her suggestion.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So um, after you put the suggestion in the box, how long did it take for the roller skating thing to happen.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, oh, about three months.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, so I guess that’s about ah, two weeks before the topless thing kicks in.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering carrying a box) Hey!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I got you something! Open it! Open it!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay. (He opens it and it’s a baby chick) It’s a chicken.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It’s cute, huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, you guys, do you know anything about chicks?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Fowl? No. Women? Nooo.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, well they are a huge responsibility, especially at this age. They require constant care. They-they need just the right food, and lot’s and lot’s of love.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, well no problem there. (He picks up the chick, hugs it really tight, and talks to it like it’s a little baby.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Easy Lenny.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is talking to Phoebe about her suggestion.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Pete is talking to Monica about the restaurant.]

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: So? I mean have you thought about it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. Here’s the thing.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Oh no, not the thing. I hate the thing. What’s the thing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I can’t do it. I’m sorry, I wish I could, but umm, see you have these feelings for me....

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, that’s-that’s what you’re worried about? If that’s the problem, we’ve got no problem.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: No! Look, I was gonna tell you this over dinner, but I met somebody else. On my trip.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Her name’s Ann, she’s a journalist. Ahh, we met on the plane. She asked me if she could finish off my peanuts, I thought she said something else, we had a big laugh. Yeah, I just, I mean I got, I got tired of waiting.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s great! I mean I’m-I’m sorry, but I’m so happy for you. And now I can work for you!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I guess you can.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! (she rolls over and kisses him on the cheek) All right, y'know what? I’m just gonna roll right into that office and-and quit!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. (she gets ready to go) Can you give me a little push?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure. Good luck!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (rolling towards the office) I’m quitting!! Woo-hoo! (She rolls through a doorway and out of sight. We then hear a big crash, and see Monica roll past the door the other way.) I’m okay!! I’m all right!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Pete) Wow! That’s exciting, you went to Japan, made up a woman.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m just saying, this woman, I mean she’s fictitious. No?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Why would you say that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ‘Cause you’re still into Monica. So you told her there was somebody else so she would agree to work with you, so ‘cause you figure oh if you spent a lot of time together, maybe something might happen, and...

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: You’re good. You’re good!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, no, I’m fairly intuitive and psychic. It’s a substantial gift.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Listen, can you promise me that you won’t tell her though?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Absolutely, oh I promise. Tell her what?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Thanks a lot.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No I’m serious. I mean I’m intuitive, but my memory sucks.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Pete is talking to Monica about the restaurant.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is baby-chick sitting.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, but this is the last time. (singing) With a chick-chick here, and a chick-chick there. Here a chick, there a chick, everywhere a chick-chick-(Joey enters)-chickeeeen.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How’s she doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well yeah, don’t-don’t you think it’s a she?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don’t know. (He picks the chick up and turns it over, trying to determine the sex of the chick, and blows on it.) I can’t tell, what ever it was went back in too quickly.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, anyway, I got to go change, I’m ah, meeting some of the cast for drinks.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Excuse me?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I stayed home from work today while you were at rehearsal so somebody could be here with our chick!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey! Who was up from 2 o’clock this morning until 5 o’clock this morning trying to get her back to sleep?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You don’t think I get up when you get up?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ohhh, here it comes.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, here it comes! I’m stuck here all day, and then you come in and spend two seconds with us and then expect to go off gallivanting with your friends? Well I don’t think so mister!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!! I need to relax! Okay? I was working all day!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And you don’t think taking care of our chick is work?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That’s not what I said. Okay, I just meant...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know what you meant!! (pause) You notice that ever since we got this chick, we’ve been fighting a lot more than we used too?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don’t know, maybe we weren’t ready to have a chick.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’ll take her back tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Do you think we’ll get our three bucks back?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering carrying a garment bag) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sees the chick) Ohhh, hey! All right, listen, I-I have that TV thing in like two hours, and I need your help, okay? What do you think? (takes out two suits) This blue suit, or this brown one?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, the brown one brings out your eyes, but your butt looks great in the blue one.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Really? (Joey gives him a ‘Like I would know’ look)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is baby-chick sitting.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to take some aspirin.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (she reaches for the bottle) Oww! (She grabs the bottle, but has trouble opening it. She pops the top off and aspirins fly all over the place as Ross enters.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wow! That aspirin dance really works!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (She bends over to try and pick up the aspirin) Oww!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God, is that still...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m fine, I’m fine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No you’re not.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes I am!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look, I’m fine. Watch. (She picks up an aspirin between her toes) Look at that. (She lifts her leg to grab the aspirin with her hand and almost falls over.) Whoa-whoa!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (stopping her from falling) Okay, okay. Look, you have got to go to a doctor! Okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. I have got to get ready and go to a dinner at my bosses house. It’s a very big deal, there’s a lot of people there I have to meet.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And I’m sure you’re gonna make a big impression. Hi! I’m Rachel Green. It’s nice to meet you. (He lifts his leg and imitates shaking hands with it, just like how Rachel was trying to pick up the aspirin with her feet.) Come on, you probably have a broken rib!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I will go to the hospital tomorrow, it’ll still be broken then.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But y'know, I could use a hand getting ready.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rachel...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look, either help me or go.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fine. I’ll go.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (with a hurt expression on her face) Okay, but before you go, could you help me first?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (He checks his watch) Sure. I’ll help you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (rushing in) Oh, good! Good! Do you guys know how to get a chick out of a VCR?!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to take some aspirin.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel is trying to put on eye liner with her left
hand, as Ross is setting out her shoes.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (She drops the brush) Y'know what? I cannot do this with my left hand! Would you please, help me with this too?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ohh. (He drops the shoes, takes the brush from her, and licks the tip. He doesn’t like how it tastes.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (taking the brush back) Okay. Let’s use this brush. (Hands him another one.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. This stuff?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Careful. Light. Okay, do you know how, just sweep it across the lid. Okay? Just sweep it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oke-dokey. (He pokes her in the eye with the brush.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh-ho!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey! That’s just poking me in the eye!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sorry, I’m sorry. Close, close, close...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, just sweep it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m sweeping...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sweep, sweep....(He starts to paint it on her eye, making it look like she has a black eye.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, now make it even, ‘cause we don’t...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We don’t want it-it to be too much, we want it to be subtle.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No. No, y'know you don’t, you don’t wear enough of this. (Rachel is shocked) What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Since when, since when do you think I don’t wear enough of this?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well I, close your eyes, I just think you’re gonna like this a little better, ‘cause, close-close... (He gets some more on the brush)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Blow it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (blows it) Sorry. ‘Cause umm, I think this will make you a little more sophisticated.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sophisticated like a hooker?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel is trying to put on eye liner with her left
hand, as Ross is setting out her shoes.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica is entering, Phoebe is already there.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, guess what I’m doing tonight.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I’m checking out the restaurant with Pete.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ohh, Monica, I am so excited for you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, I have to tell you something.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But I can’t tell you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, but wouldn’t it be easier if you had to tell me something that you could tell me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, sure in a perfect world. But, no, I promised I wouldn’t tell, and I swore to like all my gods.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. Does it have to do with Ross and Rachel?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Does it have to do with Joey?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Does it have to do with-with Chandler and that sock that he keeps by his bed?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, but let’s come back to that later!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica is entering, Phoebe is already there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel’s Bedroom, Ross is finishing up her make-up.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: There you go! Good enough for your party, huh?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yep?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sure, I’ll just sit next to the trans-sexual from purchasing.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, come on! All right, I gotta go! So good luck at the party. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh wait, Ross, would you just stay and help me get dressed?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (checks his watch) Sure, okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Okay, great! Umm, okay, just turn around.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t want you to see me naked!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rachel, I’ve seen you naked a million times. I ate hot fudge off you naked. Remember, I-I sucked that mini-marshmallow out of your belly button?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, but that was different. Y’know? I mean, we were, we were going out then, now I think it’s weird.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach, y'know I can see you naked any time I want.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All I have to do is close my eyes. See? (closes his eyes) Woo-hoo!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross! Stop that!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on! I don’t want you thinking of me like that any more!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ahh, sorry, nothing you can do about it. It’s one of my ah, rights as the ex-boyfriend. (closes his eyes again) Oop, oh yeah!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Stop it! Cut it out! Cut it out!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, I’m sorry, it will never happen... (closes eyes) Uh-oh! Wait a minute! Wait-wait, now there are a hundred of you and I’m the king.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Rosss...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on, would you grow up? It’s no big deal.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right. (She starts to take off her robe) Fine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yowzah!!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: O-kay!! See what you did, I’m gonna be doing it by myself now. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Aww, come on.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That’s it. (She crawls onto the bed) Ow!!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh-ow!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow! Ow!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Easy. Easy. You have to go to the hospital. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, I do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I really do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, I’m gonna get your coat and then I’ll-I’ll put you in a cab.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Oh wait, wait-wait, you’re not gonna come with me?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (He thinks about it) Of course I am. I just have to make a call.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay? (goes into the living room)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you. (She goes to take off her make-up and screams in pain) Oww!!!! God!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (rushing back in) What?! I wh-, what’s wrong?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, I just can’t go to the hospital lookin’ like this.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Rachel’s Bedroom, Ross is finishing up her make-up.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica is trying to find out what Phoebe won’t tell her.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Does it involve travel?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Noo!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Does it involve clogs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, wait. Clogs, or claws?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Clogs.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Claws?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, so it doesn’t involve Ross or Rachel or Chandler or Joey. But, what about Pete?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Shaking her head yes) No!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What is it?! What about Pete?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don’t know! (frantically points at Monica)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, I feel like I’m talking to Lassie. All right, Phoebe would you just tell me!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I can’t!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, I gotta go. (gets up)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I, but you’re so close! No!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, does it involve something to do with Pete’s computer company?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, just go. You’re never gonna get it!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica is trying to find out what Phoebe won’t tell her.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching Baywatch with the baby chick.
He’s on one leather chair, the chick is on the other. It’s watching Yasmine
Bleeth run and is chirping.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know. See, yes. That’s Yasmine Bleeth, she’s a completely different kind of chick. I love you both. But in very different ways.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sees he’s watching Baywatch ) Ohhh. (sees he still has the chick) Ahh! What are you doing?! I thought you were gonna take her back to the store today.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I did! But the store wouldn’t take her back! So then I took her to the shelter, and you know what I found out?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: If they can’t find a home for her, they kill her! And I’m not gonna let that happen to little Yasmine!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, good, good, good, ‘cause, good, ‘cause I was kinda having second thoughts too.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay. And it’s not just chicks y'know? It’s all kinds of other animals!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That’s horrible! Well, you did the right thing man.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks, I’m glad you see it that way.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ohhh-hoo, funny story!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching Baywatch with the baby chick.
He’s on one leather chair, the chick is on the other. It’s watching Yasmine
Bleeth run and is chirping.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Pete’s Restaurant’s Kitchen, Pete is showing Monica around the
kitchen.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t believe this! Wow, look at this refrigerator! It’s gigantic! I mean I could live in this thing! I’d be cold, but I’m always cold. Oh my God, look at these spider burners! I love spider burners.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: So you like it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much. (runs over and hugs him)

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Oh, you’re welcome. (He takes a deep breath)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did you just smell my hair?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Nooo. Uh-huh, no way. What? No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh God.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You still have feelings for me don’t you?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Now, nooo! I’m just excited about the restaurant, that’s all.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Pete.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Okay, I love you. Is that so bad?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, it’s not bad. It’s not bad at all. It’s-it’s really nice.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Look, the only who stands to get hurt is me. And I’m okay with that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You may be okay about getting hurt, but I am not okay with being the one who hurts you. That’s why I can’t take this job.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And well, we probably shouldn’t see each other anymore. I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Okay, yeah. I mean... If that’s, if that’s really what you want, okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, bye.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I’m sorry things didn’t work out...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. (She kisses him back on the lips) Oh, wow! (They then hug and kiss, very passionately.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Pete’s Restaurant’s Kitchen, Pete is showing Monica around the
kitchen.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hallway Between The Apartments, Ross and Rachel are coming back from the
hospital. Ross is helping her up the stairs.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, you’d tell me the truth. Right?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach, you can’t look fat in an x-ray.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay! Now you stay out here, and you think about what you did!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) That’s a duck.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s a bad duck!!! (to Ross) How’d the thing go tonight, Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, it was, nah, well....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What thing? What thing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nothing, ah there was this thing at the museum. Come on. (they go into her apartment) Easy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to the duck) Okay, now when you come back I hope you remember that, that chick is not a toy! (He goes back into the apartment)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What thing? What is this thing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I was kinda, supposed to be on TV tonight for The Discovery Channel .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, why didn’t you tell me that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Eh, ‘cause I knew that if I told you, you’d make me go, and I knew you needed someone to be with you tonight. Come on. Come on.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I cannot believe you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That is the sweetest thing, I just....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (breaking the silence) You should get some sleep.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, I’ll umm...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I’m sorry I spoiled you’re evening.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, that’s, no, as long as you’re okay. So I’ll ah, I’ll see you tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um-hmm, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (After he closes the door) See ya.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (coming out of his apartment and seeing Ross) What did you do?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Hallway Between The Apartments, Ross and Rachel are coming back from the
hospital. Ross is helping her up the stairs.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey’s Bathroom: Chandler is watching the duck swim in
the bathtub.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What ‘cha doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Having a swim.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What about the chick?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Chicks don’t swim.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Are you sure?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don’t know. Should we try it?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: See, I told you they don’t swim. (He goes to take it out)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (stopping him) Wait. Give him a minute.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Noo! (takes him out) Oh, it’s okay, it’s okay, baby, baby, baby.

scenes.location:
Chandler and Joey’s Bathroom: Chandler is watching the duck swim in
the bathtub.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey’s Bathroom: Chandler is watching the duck swim in
the bathtub.]
